reviews.review: I never saw the first Frozen but i was pretty sure my college education would be able to keep me up with this movie. I cant complain it was a damn good movie. It reminded me of a final fantasy video game. A bunch of useless friends and heroes except for the main character. And guess what they didnt shy away from the fact that it was the white man's fault. 8 outta 10 a solid DISNEY movie all around.
omg. Better than the original film.  vibrant,  crisp detail in story and in the animation.  certain to be a Disney Classic.
This movie is so worth it ðŸ¥ºðŸ’–
The songs were great.  The story was different than a lot of Disney movies but in a good way

The improvements in animation are beautiful to see. The details on the clothing and the addition of breath movements while the characters are singing are subtle but amazing. My only critic is that only one or two of the songs are as memorable as the songs from the original. However it was still very enjoyable!
The movie was pretty good. The only thing I disliked was how short the plot was! It was very fast paced for me and my grand daughters.
Hard to care about the characters in this sequel. Story was muddled and confusing as well. Won't stop Disney from making Frozen III though.

Frozen II matures along with the children who loved the first movie. It addresses more mature concepts and develops the characters through believable and emotional situations. The visuals are absolutely incredible and the music feels less childish than the first movie. It's as close to a perfect movie as Disney has gotten in at least 6 years.
To much strange fantasy and musical scenes at the wrong time. You know what you need to do, quit singing and go find your sister.

While the animation is breathtaking, the movie itself suffers from a convoluted story, confusing additions (what is the point of the fire lizard?), and too many (and not as good) songs. Disney took on a nearly impossible task trying to catch lightening in a bottle for a second time, and it didn't live up. The story is hard to follow and I found myself being annoyed by the same beloved characters from the first Frozen (for instance: Anna is obnoxious, Elsa is annoyingly drifty and ADD ["Squirrel!"], Kristoff seems dumb, etc). They tried to make too many self-referential lines to link to the first Frozen (believe me, people remember the first movie) and pushed a convoluted, unclear, esoteric message. PS - the songs weren't nearly as catchy or fun (I appreciated Kristoff's 80s love song, but I'm not sure it was needed?). Overall: Glad I saw it but I left feeling disappointed and scratching my head.
